Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Temporin-1CEc (Dybowskin-1CDYa; D-1CDYa; UCLL1c; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXA)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Strongly active against S. aureus (MIC 6 uM) and E. coli (MIC 3 uM). Conflict: Inactive against E.coli AS 1.349 (MIC > 100 uM),  P.aeruginosa CGMCC 1.860 (MIC > 100 uM), E.aerogenes CGMCC 1.876 (MIC > 100 uM), E.cloacae CGMCC 1.58 (MIC > 100 uM), K.pneumoniae (MIC > 100 uM), S.aureus AS 1.72 (MIC > 100 uM), B.cereus AS 1.126 (MIC > 100 uM), S.lactis AS 1.1690 (MIC >100 uM), E.faecalis (MIC >100 uM), E.faecium CGMCC 1.2334 (MIC >100 uM) (Ji et al., 2022).Toxicity: not hemo.lytic HC50 >450 uM.Structure:  helical in TFE or SDS. See also Shang et al. (2009) Zoo Sci 26, 220-226. Updated 5/2020; 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Jin LL, Song SS, Li Q, Chen YH, Wang QY, Hou ST2009
Literature Information.Title: Identification and characterisation of a novel antimicrobial polypeptide from the skin secretion of a Chinese frog (Rana chensinensis).
